intro: Monochaetum linearifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved monochaetum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family, Poaceae, and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny flowers. It is typically found in open, sandy soils in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
